Dear Heather L Calcaterra:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
1

(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 aggressively engaged Youth A.
Investigation
Interviews were conducted face to face at the facility on 11/8/24
unless otherwise specified.
Interviews:
Administrator 1
I spoke to Administrator 1 on 10/29/24. Administrator 1 reviewed
the video and reported that Staff 1 should have walked away from
the situation, but she did not. It was noted by Administrator 1 that
Staff 1 was engaged aggressively. Administrator 1 did not
describe this.
Staff 1:
Staff 1 reported she was scheduled as Youth A’s individual staff
on 10/27/24. Youth A is on a 1:1 supervision plan. Staff 1 reported
Youth A was already agitated when she began her shift at
3:00pm. Youth A started to target her and threaten her. Staff 1
reported they were in the hallway and Youth A hit her and
continued to name call her, threatening and raising his voice. Staff
1 reported Supervisor 1 was in the area and intervened. Staff 1
reported she raised her voice and said, “Don’t touch me. If you do
there are gonna be issues.” Staff 1 admitted this may have
appeared threatening to Youth A. Staff 1 reported it was her first
time in this type of situation, and she felt that she used her
training. Staff 1 reported she extended her arms to get Youth A
away from her but felt that this movement was appropriate to
protect herself. Staff 1 and I watched the video of the incident
together and Staff 1 was able to see she pushed Youth A and
walked towards him with her arm in the air. Staff 1 acknowledged
she pushed Youth A and should have disengaged from the
situation.
Youth A:
Youth A reported he did not remember the incident. Youth A
reported he has never been hit, pushed, or yelled at by staff at the
facility.
2

Supervisor 1:
On 12/10/24 I interviewed Supervisor 1 via telephone. Supervisor
1 reported she was involved in the situation on 10/27/24.
Supervisor 1 reported Youth A hit Staff 1 in the hallway of the
facility. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 extended her arms out, but
did not push Youth A. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A kept
attempting to attack Staff 1 and Staff 1 continued to stay in the
situation by moving towards Youth A. Supervisor 1 reported
normally staff would move away from the youth or the space.
Supervisor 1 reported when Staff 1 extended her arms out
towards Youth A, it was an attempt to just keep Youth A away
from her.
Video Observation:
I reviewed the video for the incident. The date of the incident was
10/27/24. The incident occurred at 6:19pm. Youth A and Staff 1
are seen in the hallway of the facility. Youth A pushed Staff 1.
Staff 1 pushed Youth A on the chest area and pushed his back as
well. Supervisor 1 is seen coming between them to separate
Youth A from Staff 1. Youth A walked away and Staff 1 walked
towards Youth A, arm raised, verbalizing something. (No audio
was available, but it was clear based on facial movement Staff 1
was talking to Youth A).
Documents:
• I reviewed Staff 1’s personnel file. Staff 1 was hired on
6/1/24 and completed 167 hours of training, including CPI
Module (2/20/24) Resident Management and Care (6/1/24),
Trauma Responsive Care (9/27/24), and Developmental
Stages of Children (2/20/24). All Clearances are up to date
for Staff 1. Staff 1 does not have any disciplinary action in
her file.
• Youth A’s Behavioral Calming Plan was reviewed. Youth A
does not like to hear the word, “No.” Youth A will become
agitated and will become aggressive.
• CPI Module was reviewed. CPI does not use pushing a
youth as non-violent intervention.
Analysis Based on the interview with Staff 1 and the video observation,
Staff 1 pushed Youth A. Staff 1 has been trained in CPI and has
been given the proper tools to use in this situation, but did not
utilize them.
Consultation:
Consultation was offered that it may benefit the agency to use 1:1
staff/youth supervision as a training tool for newer staff. This
3

particular youth has a history of being assaultive and easily
triggered. Newer staff could possibly shadow 1:1’s during
orientation or even throughout the year to learn firsthand de-
escalation techniques.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a
youth's background or appearance or mental state. Yelling,
threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 yelled at Youth A. Supervisor 1 intervened.
Investigation
Interviews were conducted face to face at the facility on 11/8/24
unless otherwise specified.
Interviews:
I spoke to Administrator 1 on 10/29/24. Administrator 1 reviewed
the video and reported that Staff 1 should have walked away from
the situation, but she did not. It was noted by Administrator 1 that
Staff 1 was engaged aggressively and had made verbal threats to
Youth A.
Youth A:
Youth A reported he did not remember the incident. Youth A
reported that none of the staff at the facility has ever called him
inappropriate names.
Staff 1:
Staff 1 reported she was scheduled as Youth A’s individual staff
on 10/27/24. Youth A is on a 1:1 supervision plan. Staff 1 reported
Youth A was already agitated when she began her shift at
3:00pm. Youth A started to target her and threaten her. Staff 1
reported they were in the hallway and Youth A hit her and
4

continued to name call her, threatening and raising his voice. Staff
1 reported she met Youth A’s raised voice to talk to him. Staff 1
reported she raised her voice and said, “Don’t touch me. If you do
there are gonna be issues.” Staff 1 admitted this may have
appeared threatening to Youth A. Staff 1 reported it was her first
time in this type of situation, and she felt that she used her
training. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 1 intervened and deescalate
the situation and she was able to leave the area.
Supervisor 1:
Supervisor 1 reported she was involved in the situation on
10/27/24 between Youth A and Staff 1. Supervisor 1 reported Staff
1 raised her voice, but she does not recall what was said.
Supervisor 1 was unable to state whether Staff 1’s words were
appropriate or not.
Video Observation:
I reviewed the video for the incident. The date of the incident was
10/27/24. The incident occurred at 6:19pm. No audio was
available, but it was clear based on facial movement Staff 1 was
talking to Youth A during the incident.
Documents:
• I reviewed Staff 1’s personnel file. Staff 1 was hired on
6/1/24 and completed 167 hours of training, including CPI
Module (2/20/24) (add date of most recent training),
Resident Management and Care (6/1/24), Trauma
Responsive Care (9/27/24), and Developmental Stages of
Children (2/20/24). All Clearances are up to date for Staff 1.
Staff 1 does not have any disciplinary action in her file.
• I reviewed the Behavior Management Policy. The policy
does not allow for staff to yell at youth.
Analysis Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 both reported Staff 1 raised her voice.
Staff 1 reported she said, “Don’t touch me. If you do there are
gonna be issues.” Not only was her voice raised towards Youth A
but her posture and comment are seen as threatening in this
situation.
Conclusion Violation Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
